author: Marcus Gilmer
description: Flying cars and fire: what could go wrong?
title: Toyota backs adorably tiny flying car that could light the Olympic flame

author: Joel Rosenblatt
description: Waymo won a ruling that may strengthen its trade-secrets suit against Uber Technologies Inc. even as the Alphabet Inc. unit fell short of its goal to bring its rival’s driverless-car program to a standstill.
title: Waymo Gains Edge Over Uber as Driverless-Car Case Heads to Trial

author: Peter Hermann, Theresa Vargas, Peter Hermann, Theresa Vargas
description: What police found in the car that March day has come to symbolize the stakes of the city’s soaring homicide rate, one of the highest in the nation.
title: ‘Did you hear that?’: Amid Baltimore’s surge in killings, a faint cry in a locked car

author: Aaron Pressman
description: Device could pinpoint whether a phone was in use during a car accident
title: New York May Require Drivers To Submit Phones to ‘Textalyzer’

author: Daniel Cooper
description: If you want a car with Android Auto built into the infotainment system, buy a next-generation Volvo or Audi.
title: Audi and Volvo go all-in on Android Auto

author: Evelyn Cheng
description: Oxford Economics found if Chinese state-owned enterprises took more of U.S. freight rail car production, U.S. jobs could take a big hit.
title: Railroad wars: Chinese imports could imperil 65,000 US jobs

author: Greg Bensinger
description: A federal judge ordered Uber to return 14,000 driverless-car documents allegedly stolen from Google parent Alphabet and barred a key executive for the ride-hailing firm from working on certain autonomous vehicle technology.
title: Uber Ordered to Return Documents in Self-Driving Fight With Waymo

description: Cars, lorries and buses that drive on diesel churn out far more air pollution than standard testing procedures suggest, even without any emissions cheating devices
title: Diesel fumes lead to thousands more deaths than thought
